title.text: EXPRESSING DISJUNCTIVE AND NEGATIVE FEATURE CONSTRAINTS WITH CLASSICAL FIRST-ORDER LOGIC

entities.text: FEATURE CONSTRAINTS WITH CLASSICAL FIRST-ORDER LOGIC

abstractContent.text: In contrast to the "designer logic" approach, this paper shows how the attribute-value feature structures of unification grammar and constraints on them can be axiomatized in classical first-order logic, which can express disjunctive and negative constraints.
Because only quantifier-free formulae are used in the axiomatization, the satisfiability problem is NP-complete.
